statements.name: PROC GREPLAY
statements.description: Defines whether the session is used for catalog management or output presentation.

arguments.name: BYLINE
arguments.description: specifies that the BY statement information for the SAS catalog entries should be displayed.

arguments.name: CC=
arguments.description: specifies the color map catalog where the color map entries are stored.

arguments.name: CMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the type of catalog entry to use with the GREPLAY procedure.

arguments.name: FS
arguments.description: this option is not supported.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the graphics output catalog.

arguments.name: IGOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the input catalog that stores the graphics output that you want to use with the GREPLAY procedure.

arguments.name: IMAGEMAP=
arguments.description: used with the REPLAY statement to create a temporary SAS data set that is used to generate an image map in an SVG file when replaying output to the LISTING destination.

arguments.name: NOBYLINE
arguments.description: specifies that the BY statement information for the SAS catalog entries should be suppressed.

arguments.name: NOFS
arguments.description: specifies that the GREPLAY procedure should use line mode.

arguments.name: PRESENTATATION
arguments.description: this option is not supported.

arguments.name: TC=
arguments.description: specifies the template catalog to use with the GREPLAY procedure, and identifies the template catalog where the template entry is stored to replay your graphics.

arguments.name: TEMPLATE=
arguments.description: identifies the template entry to use with the GREPLAY procedure.

statements.description: Writes the current value of certain PROC GREPLAY options, or of the current device driver to the SAS log. If the value is not assigned, the GREPLAY procedure issues a message to the SAS log.
statements.help: ?  CC | CMAP | DEVICE | GOUT | IGOUT | TC | TEMPLATE

arguments.name: CC
arguments.description: writes the name of the current color map catalog.

arguments.name: CMAP
arguments.description: writes the name of the current color map.

arguments.name: DEVICE
arguments.description: writes the name of the current device driver.

arguments.name: GOUT
arguments.description: writes the name of the output catalog.

arguments.name: IGOUT
arguments.description: writes the name of the input catalog.

arguments.name: TC
arguments.description: writes the name of the current template catalog.

arguments.name: TEMPLATE
arguments.description: writes the name of the current template.

statements.name: BYLINE
statements.description: Displays BY statement information directly beneath the primary description of the catalog entries when you list the input catalog contents.

statements.name: CC
statements.description: Specifies a color map catalog, and enables you to change the color map catalog without exiting the procedure.

arguments.name: color-map
arguments.description: identifies the SAS catalog where color map entries are stored.

statements.name: CCOPY
statements.description: Copies a color map from one color map catalog to another color map catalog. Creates a duplicate color map within the color map catalog.

arguments.name: libref.color-map-catalog.color-map-entry.CMAP
arguments.description: identifies the color map entry to be copied.

arguments.name: color-map-catalog
arguments.description: is the color map catalog that contains the color map to be copied.

arguments.name: color-map-entry
arguments.description: is the name of the color map entry.

arguments.name: .CMAP
arguments.description: is the color map entry type.

statements.name: CDEF
statements.description: Defines or modifies one or more color maps in the color-map catalog.
statements.help:
CDEF  color-map-entry
	color-number / from-color : to-color
	<color-number / from-color : to-color>
	< ...>
	<DES="description">;

arguments.name: color-map-entry
arguments.description: identifies a color map entry.

arguments.name: color-number
arguments.description: specifies the number of a color-mapping pair.

arguments.name: from-color
arguments.description: specifies the color to be mapped.

arguments.name: to-color
arguments.description: specifies the new color that replaces from-color in the replayed graphics output.

arguments.name: DES=
arguments.description: specifies a catalog entry description for the color map entry. Maximum length for the description is 256 characters.

statements.name: CDELETE
statements.description: Deletes one or more color map entries from the current color map catalog.

arguments.name: color-map-entry
arguments.description: identifies one or more color map entries to delete from the color map catalog.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: deletes all of the color map entries from the color map catalog.

statements.name: CMAP
statements.description: Assigns a color map entry to be used when replaying graphics output.

arguments.name: color-map-entry
arguments.description: identifies the color map entry, contained in the current color map catalog, to use when replaying your graphics output.

statements.name: COPY
statements.description: Copies one or more GRSEG catalog entries from the input catalog to the output catalog.

arguments.name: entry-id
arguments.description: is the number (in the order in which they were created) or name of a catalog entry or group of entries to be copied from the input catalog to the output catalog.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: copies all graphics output entries in the input catalog to the output catalog.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: Deletes SAS catalog entries containing graphics output from the current input catalog.

arguments.name: entry-id
arguments.description: is the number (in the order in which they were created) or name of a catalog entry or a group of entries to be deleted from the input catalog.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: deletes all graphics output entries in the input catalog.

statements.name: DEVICE
statements.description: Specifies the device driver.

arguments.name: device-name
arguments.description: specifies the device driver to use when you replay graphics output.

statements.name: GOUT
statements.description: Assigns the SAS output catalog used by the GREPLAY procedure.

arguments.name: libref.output-catalog
arguments.description: identifies the SAS catalog to use as an output catalog.

statements.name: GROUP
statements.description: Creates groups of entries in the current input catalog.

arguments.name: entry-id
arguments.description: is the number (in the order in which they were created) or name of a catalog entry.

statements.name: IGOUT
statements.description: Assigns the SAS input catalog used by the GREPLAY procedure.

arguments.name: libref.input-catalog
arguments.description: identifies the SAS catalog with entries that contain graphics output that you want to replay.

statements.name: LIST
statements.description: Lists entries in the input, template, and color map catalogs, as well as the contents of templates and color maps in the SAS log.
statements.help: LIST  CC | CMAP | IGOUT | TC | TEMPLATE

arguments.name: CC
arguments.description: lists the color maps that are in the current color map catalog.

arguments.name: CMAP
arguments.description: lists the From and To values in the current color map.

arguments.name: IGOUT
arguments.description: lists the number, name, and description of the entries in the input catalog that contain graphics output.

arguments.name: TC
arguments.description: lists the templates in the current template catalog.

arguments.name: TEMPLATE
arguments.description: lists the panel definition values of the current template.

statements.name: MODIFY
statements.description: Changes the name, description, and BY statement information of entries or group headers in the input catalog. You must specify at least one change.

arguments.name: entry-id
arguments.description: specifies the number (in the order in which they were created) or name of a catalog entry or a group of entries in the input catalog.

arguments.name: BYLINE=
arguments.description: specifies a character string that can be used for additional information or for BY statement information.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies a new name for the GRSEG catalog entry.

arguments.name: DES=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

statements.name: MOVE
statements.description: Rearranges entries in the input catalog by moving entries before or after other entries.

arguments.name: entry-id-1
arguments.description: specifies the number (in the order in which they were created) or name of a catalog entry or a group header that is to be moved.

arguments.name: entry-id-2
arguments.description: is the number (in the order in which they were created) or name of a catalog entry or a group header.

arguments.name: AFTER
arguments.description: specifies whether entry-id-1 should be moved after or before entry-id-2.

arguments.name: BEFORE
arguments.description: specifies whether entry-id-1 should be moved after or before entry-id-2.

statements.name: NOBYLINE
statements.description: Suppresses BY statement information.

statements.name: PREVIEW
statements.description: Displays the panel outlines for one or more templates using the current device. Use the TC statement to specify the template catalog before using the PREVIEW statement.

arguments.name: template-entry
arguments.description: identifies one or more template entries contained in the template catalog.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: previews all templates in the current template catalog.

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Executes any statements that have not executed and ends the procedure step.

statements.name: REPLAY
statements.description: Identifies one or more entries for replay from the input catalog.

arguments.name: entry-id
arguments.description: is the number (in the order in which they were created) or name of a catalog entry or a group of entries in the input catalog.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: replays all entries in the input catalog.

arguments.name: _FIRST_
arguments.description: replays the first entry in the input catalog.

arguments.name: _LAST_
arguments.description: replays the last entry in the input catalog.

statements.name: TC
statements.description: Specifies the template catalog for the GREPLAY procedure.

arguments.name: template-catalog
arguments.description: identifies the SAS catalog where templates are to be stored or identifies the name of a SAS catalog that contains templates.

statements.name: TCOPY
statements.description: Copies templates from a catalog to the template catalog, or creates a duplicate of a template within the template catalog.

arguments.name: template-catalog.template-entry.TEMPLATE
arguments.description: identifies the template entry to be copied.

arguments.name: template-catalog
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog that contains the template to be copied.

arguments.name: template-entry
arguments.description: specifies the template entry name.

arguments.name: TEMPLATE
arguments.description: specifies the catalog entry type.

statements.name: TDEF
statements.description: Defines or modifies templates in the template catalog.

arguments.name: template-entry
arguments.description: identifies an existing or new template.

arguments.name: DES=
arguments.description: specifies the template entry description.

arguments.name: CLIP
arguments.description: specifies that any panel behind this panel should be clipped.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the panel border color.

arguments.name: COPY=
arguments.description: specifies the panel number definition to be copied to this panel.

arguments.name: DEF
arguments.description: specifies a default panel with specific coordinates.

arguments.name: DELETE
arguments.description: deletes a panel.

arguments.name: LLX=
arguments.description: specifies the X coordinate of the lower left corner of the panel.

arguments.name: LLY=
arguments.description: specifies the Y coordinate of the lower left corner of the panel.

arguments.name: LRX=
arguments.description: specifies the X coordinate of the lower right corner of the panel.

arguments.name: LRY=
arguments.description: specifies the Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the panel.

arguments.name: PANEL-NUMBER=
arguments.description: identifies the panel number being defined or modified.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the rotation angle for the panel.

arguments.name: SCALEX=
arguments.description: specifies the scale factor for the X coordinates in the panel.

arguments.name: SCALEY=
arguments.description: specifies the scale factor for the Y coordinates in the panel.

arguments.name: ULX=
arguments.description: specifies the X coordinate upper left corner of the panel.

arguments.name: ULY=
arguments.description: specifies the Y coordinate upper left corner of the panel.

arguments.name: URX=
arguments.description: specifies the X coordinate upper right corner of the panel.

arguments.name: URY=
arguments.description: specifies the Y coordinate upper right corner of the panel.

arguments.name: XLATEX=
arguments.description: specifies the distance to move the X coordinates of the panel.

arguments.name: XLATEY=
arguments.description: specifies the distance to move the Y coordinates of the panel.

statements.name: TDELETE
statements.description: Deletes templates from the template catalog.

arguments.name: template-entry
arguments.description: identifies a template entry to be deleted from the template entry catalog.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: deletes all template entries in the template entry catalog.

statements.name: TEMPLATE
statements.description: Assigns a template to use when replaying graphics output.

arguments.name: template-entry
arguments.description: identifies an existing template to use when replaying graphics output.

statements.name: TREPLAY
statements.description: Replays graphics entries into template panels. TREPLAY copies one or more entries from the graphics input catalog into a template-entry in the graphics output catalog, using positioning information provided by the template.

arguments.name: template-panel-number
arguments.description: specifies the number of the panel in the template into which you want to replay the entry.

arguments.name: entry-id
arguments.description: specifies the name or number of the entry in the graphics input catalog that is to be added to the new entry in the graphics output catalog.

arguments.name: DES=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the entry name for the template.
